metadata.title: Professionally Built Hot Rods And Custom Rides Invade Barrett-Jackson | Motorious.com
metadata.description: Barrett-Jackson to feature world’s foremost selection of professionally built hot rods and custom vehicles at Scottsdale.
metadata.author: Elizabeth Puckett

metadata.title: 1934 Ford Tudor Hot Rod Is A Turn-Key Cruiser | Motorious.com
metadata.description: Slow roll the car show in this low-key ’34 Ford hot rod.
metadata.author: Jeffrey N. Ross

sections: This massive collection of hotrods is up for grabs, if you want to go get one.
In the vast forests of Alaska, you wouldn’t expect to find much of anything unnatural. Yet, for John McDonald, filling a clearing with eight-decade-old American metal seems to come naturally.
Over his 31-years of living in North Pole, Alaska, McDonald has acquired quite the collection; ranging from
and even a WWII era ambulance. The last one looks like something straight out of
He accredits most of his collection as the direct result of online search results and eBay. He states without any shame at all, “If I’m attracted to it, I’ll get it so I can enjoy it.”
But with a bucket list that changes every week, he realizes that there just isn't time to deal with all of his projects. Therefore, just about everything in his yard is for sale.
After meeting John McDonald a few weeks earlier at a Fairbanks car event,
host Tom Cotter makes the drive down the gravel lane leading to McDonald’s place – where he finds the antique collection surrounded by the spruce filled forests of Alaska.
McDonald and his puppy, Banjo, are waiting to show off his collection of cars and trucks to a host that has his doubts of hearing anything actually run.
Among McDonalds collection is a red and white 1957
packing a 312 V-8, a red 1960 Studebaker Champ truck, a 1932 Ford 1.5-ton dually, a ‘33 pickup, and quite a few more classic Studebakers.

Much to Toms surprise nearly all of the aging automobiles start right up with a turn of the key. It is obvious from the sound of them that McDonald puts a lot of effort into maintaining the mechanical aspects of his cars, and gets a lot of enjoyment out of driving them around. With Banjo sitting on the bench seat next to him.
